intro: Musineon ehrenbergii, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of gray-green, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, followed by fluffy seed heads that aid in wind dispersal. Musineon ehrenbergii is adapted to survive in harsh environments with limited water availability. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and drought tolerance.
